database.query:
SELECT 
  s.nome AS col_patient_name,
  '12345678' AS col_patient_id,
  '20030201' AS col_birth_date,
  'M' AS col_patient_sex,
  'TORAX - PA' AS col_exam_description,
  'P102025' AS col_accession_number,
  '20251216' AS col_exam_date,
  '143000' AS col_exam_time,
  'MARY JONES' AS col_physician_name,
  'CR' AS col_modality,
  'HIGH' AS col_priority,
  'URGENCIA' AS col_encounter_type,
  '456789' AS col_encounter_id,
  'EMERGENCY ROOM' AS col_unit_name,
  'FCR0101' AS col_procedure_code,
  'CHEST X-RAY' AS col_code_meaning,
  'CBR' AS col_code_scheme
FROM SIS_UTLIZADOR s

column_mapping.description: The full name of the patient. Used for patient identification on the modality and in reports.
A unique identifier for the patient within the hospital or system. This is crucial for linking studies.
The patient's date of birth, formatted as YYYYMMDD. Important for age-related protocol checks and patient demographics.
The patient's biological sex. Typically represented as M (Male), F (Female), or O (Other).
column_mapping.format: Single character: M, F, or O

column_mapping.description: A free-text description of the procedure or exam requested. This helps the technologist understand the context.
A unique identifier for the specific request (the order). In Worklist, this is often the Accession Number or order ID.
The scheduled or requested date for the exam, formatted as YYYYMMDD.
The scheduled or requested time for the exam, formatted as HH24MISS (24-hour format).
The name of the physician/provider responsible for ordering or referring the exam.
The type of imaging equipment that will perform the exam. Standard DICOM modality codes (CR=Radiography, CT=Computed Tomography, US=Ultrasound, MR=Magnetic Resonance, etc.)
A derived priority level based on triage classification. Used for scheduling and workflow prioritization.
The type of hospital visit or encounter: URGENCIA (Emergency), INTERNACAO (Inpatient), or AMBULATORIO (Outpatient).
The unique identifier for the patient's current hospital encounter or admission.
The name of the hospital unit or sector where the patient is located or where the request originated.
A coded value identifying the specific procedure being requested. Often prefixed with an institutional code (e.g., FCR for your system).
The descriptive meaning associated with the procedure code.
Identifies the coding system used for the procedure code (e.g., SNOMED, CBR, DCM, etc.).
